item.title: bíogo/ncbi: interfaces to NCBI services for the Go language
item.description:
Biotechnology Information (US), National Center for. 2005. “Entrez Programming Utilities Help.” https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK3836/.

———. 2010. “Entrez Programming Utilities Help.” https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK25501/.

———. 2017a. “Basic Local Alignment Search Tool.” Accessed March 3. https://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi.

———. 2017b. “Common Url Api.” Accessed March 3. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/BLAST/Doc/urlapi.html.

Cock P.J.A., et al. 2009. “Biopython: Freely Available Python Tools for Computational Molecular Biology and Bioinformatics.” Bioinformatics 25 (11): 1422–3. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btp163.

Fields C. 2017a. “Bio-Eutilities.” Accessed March 3. https://github.com/bioperl/bioperl-run.

———. 2017b. “Bio-Eutilities.” Accessed March 3. https://github.com/bioperl/Bio-EUtilities.

Stajich J.E., et al. 2002. “The Bioperl Toolkit: Perl Modules for the Life Sciences.” Genome Research 12 (10): 1611–8. doi:10.1101/gr.361602.

item.title: bíogo: a simple high-performance bioinformatics toolkit for the Go language
item.description: Kortschak, R. D., and D. L. Adelson. 2014. “bíogo: A Simple High-Performance Bioinformatics Toolkit for the Go Language.” BioRxiv. doi:10.1101/005033.

item.title: bíogo/hts: high throughput sequence handling for the Go language
item.description:
Tarasov A., Vilella A., Cuppen E., Nijman I. J., and Prins P. 2015. “Sambamba: Fast Processing of Ngs Alignment Formats.” Bioinformatics 31 (12): 2032–4. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btv098.

The SAM/BAM Format Specification Working Group. 2016. “Sequence Alignment/Map Format Specification.” https://samtools.github.io/hts-specs/SAMv1.pdf.

Li H., Handsaker B., Wysoker A., Fennell T., Ruan J., Homer N., Marth G., Abecasis G., Durbin R., and 1000 Genome Project Data Processing Subgroup. 2012. “The Sequence Alignment/Map Format and Samtools.” Bioinformatics 25 (16): 2078–9. doi:10.1093/bioinformatics/btp352.

item.title: LINEs between Species: Evolutionary Dynamics of LINE-1 Retrotransposons across the Eukaryotic Tree of Life

Contextual models and the non-Newtonian paradigm
EST Analysis of the Cnidarian Acropora millepora Reveals Extensive Gene Loss and Rapid Sequence Divergence in the Model Invertebrates
item.description: A brief commentary on the paper is available in Nature News and Views.

item.title: Evolutionary analysis of vertebrate Notch genes
ARID proteins come in from the desert
Characterization of the dead ringer gene identifies a novel, highly conserved family of sequence-specific DNA-binding proteins
